casebody.data:
No. 3384 Second Circuit CITY OF MONROE, ET AL. v. COOPER, ET AL. CITY OF MONROE, ET AL. v. BREARD CITY OF MONROE, ET AL. v. HAWKS CITY OF MONROE, ET AL. v. HUDSON CITY OF MONROE, ET AL. v. BREARD, JR. No. 3385

Second Circuit

No. 3386

Second Circuit

No. 3387

Second Circuit

No. 3388

Second Circuit

(November 12, 1928. Opinion and Decree.) H. H. Russell; Theus, Grisham and Davis, of Monroe, attorneys for plaintiffs, appellees. Hudson, Potts, Bernstein & Sholars, of Monroe, attorneys for defendants, appellants. BY WHOLE COURT.

This Court has no jurisdiction in this case, because the controversy involves the constitutionality or legality of a local improvement assessment imposed by the municipality of the City of Monroe. The Supreme Court has appellate jurisdiction in such cases (See Sec. 10, Art. VII, Constitution of 1921).

It is therefore ordered that this case be transferred to the Supreme Court.
